pullRequest.body:
Prove regularity of `RieszContent`, define the Riesz measure `μ Λ` and prove basic properties.

Motivation: these definitions and lemmas will be used to prove the Riesz-Markov-Kakutani theorem, characterizing `μ Λ`.

In this PR, it is assumed to be NNReal-linear. In this way, the proof of the RMK theorem will be twice as long as a proof for `Real`-linear `Λ` because one cannot define `-f`. #12290 proves the RMK theorem for real linear `Λ`, using the Riesz measure defined in this PR through `toNNRealLinear`.

---
- [x] depends on: #21206 for `partialOrder`

Most probably the naming `Λ_mono` is not good, but I don't know which is the right one.

nodes.body: messageFile.md
Great to see this moving forward! Could you please address the comments I made on #12290 ? Thanks!
Thanks for your reviews! sure, I will do it.
thanks for massive golfing!

Can you clarify the status of the PR? It's marked as RFC (request for comments), but to me it looks like a normal PR, that could be merged quickly if you deal with the last comments by @YaelDillies, so I'm a little bit confused.
messageFile.md
messageFile.md

Sorry for my late replies and commits. I put RFC because I can only first prove the `Real`-linear version of the RMK theorem #12290 although here `Λ` is `NNReal`-linear. One has to go back and forth between `Real` and `NNReal` to prove finally the `NNReal`-version of the RMK theorem, and I wanted to ask whether it's ok.

I made small PR's as requested and updated the docstring.

This PR/issue depends on:
* ~~leanprover-community/mathlib4#21206~~
By **[Dependent Issues](https://github.com/z0al/dependent-issues)** (🤖). Happy coding!

`+ contentRegular_rieszContent`

<details>


<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>

```suggestion
    (h : tsupport f ⊆ K) : .ofNNReal (Λ f) ≤ rieszMeasure Λ K := by
```

What about
```suggestion
lemma CompactlySupportedContinuousMap.monotone_of_nnreal : Monotone Λ := by
```
`LE` is not defined for `C_c(X, NNReal)`. for the moment I revert this.
Can you leave a comment about why you can't spell that lemma with `Monotone`?
done
actually, it was not difficult to use `Monotone`. done

```suggestion
lemma rieszContent_ne_top {K : Compacts X} : rieszContent Λ K ≠ ⊤ := by
```

```suggestion
  simp only [rieszContent, le_antisymm_iff, le_iInf_iff, ENNReal.coe_le_coe]
  constructor
```
will let you golf things below

```suggestion
      have : Λ f * α = Λ (α.toNNReal • f) := by
```
Why is this about `V : Opens X` rather than `V : Set X` + `IsOpen V`?
I did so because in #12290 I defined `V` which takes value in `Opens`. Should I change?
Yeah, more syntactically general lemmas are better, unless you think this lemma will only ever be used for `V : Opens X`, but I don't really see why that would be the case myself
I see. done and changed the names of the lemmas

```suggestion
      set K' := f ⁻¹' Ici α⁻¹.toNNReal with hK'
```
Same thing here for `K`

```suggestion
lemma CompactlySupportedContinuousMap.monotone_of_nnreal {f₁ f₂ : C_c(X, ℝ≥0)} (h : f₁.1 ≤ f₂.1) :
```
Any reason you're squeezing this simp? It's already terminal
no particular reason (here I have to first `rw`). Why should one not squeeze?
[This is explained in the style guide](https://leanprover-community.github.io/contribute/style#squeezing-simp-calls)
ah, I thought I had read through the style guide but I had missed it, sorry!
It was added recently!

Can you make the docstring not rely on context that the reader can only access by scrolling through the file?

Currently if I hover over `rieszMeasure` and see
```
`rieszContent` is promoted to a measure.
```
I still don't know what `rieszMeasure` is
I explained what `rieszContent` is, is this what you mean?

From
```
/-- `rieszContent` gives a `Content` from `Λ : C_c(X, ℝ≥0) →ₗ[ℝ≥0] ℝ≥0`. Here `rieszContent Λ` is
promoted to a measure. -/
```
I still have no idea what `rieszMeasure` is or does. Eg what values does it take? what important property does it have?

I tried adding a description (which is [MeasureTheory.Content.measure_apply](https://leanprover-community.github.io/mathlib4_docs/Mathlib/MeasureTheory/Measure/Content.html#MeasureTheory.Content.measure_apply)), is this what you mean?
I would like to be able to understand the definition without having to read any other docstring. Currently, you still require me to read up what `Content.outerMeasure` does
I don't know how to characterize `rieszMeasure` without using some other definitions. I wrote the RMK theorem for characterization, is this fine?

```suggestion
lemma le_rieszMeasure_of_isCompact_tsupport_subset {f : C_c(X, ℝ≥0)} (hf : ∀ x, f x ≤ 1)
```

```suggestion
lemma exist_add_eq {f₁ f₂ : C_c(α, ℝ≥0)} (h : f₁.1 ≤ f₂.1)  : ∃ (g : C_c(α, ℝ≥0)), f₁ + g = f₂ := by
```

Here is a golf
```suggestion
  refine ⟨fun K' hK' ↦ rieszContentAux_mono Λ (hK'.trans interior_subset), ?_⟩
  rw [iInf_le_iff]
  intro b hb
  rw [rieszContentAux, ENNReal.le_coe_iff]
  have : b < ⊤ := by
    obtain ⟨F, hF⟩ := exists_compact_superset K.2
    exact (le_iInf_iff.mp (hb ⟨F, hF.1⟩) hF.2).trans_lt ENNReal.coe_lt_top
  refine ⟨b.toNNReal, (ENNReal.coe_toNNReal this.ne).symm, NNReal.coe_le_coe.mp ?_⟩
  apply le_iff_forall_pos_le_add.mpr
  intro ε hε
  lift ε to ℝ≥0 using hε.le
  obtain ⟨f, hfleoneonK, hfle⟩ := exists_lt_rieszContentAux_add_pos Λ K (Real.toNNReal_pos.mpr hε)
  rw [rieszContentAux, Real.toNNReal_of_nonneg hε.le, ← NNReal.coe_lt_coe] at hfle
  refine ((le_iff_forall_one_lt_le_mul₀ (zero_le (Λ f))).mpr fun α hα ↦ ?_).trans hfle.le
  rw [mul_comm, ← smul_eq_mul, ← map_smul]
  set K' := f ⁻¹' Ici α⁻¹
  have hKK' : ↑K ⊆ interior K' :=
    subset_interior_iff.2 ⟨f ⁻¹' Ioi α⁻¹, isOpen_Ioi.preimage f.1.2,
      fun x hx ↦ (inv_lt_one_of_one_lt₀ hα).trans_le (hfleoneonK x hx),
      preimage_mono Ioi_subset_Ici_self⟩
  have hK'cp : IsCompact K' := .of_isClosed_subset f.2 (isClosed_Ici.preimage f.1.2) fun x hx ↦
    subset_closure ((inv_pos_of_pos <| zero_lt_one.trans hα).trans_le hx).ne'
  set hb' := hb ⟨K', hK'cp⟩
  simp only [Compacts.coe_mk, le_iInf_iff] at hb'
  exact (ENNReal.toNNReal_mono (by simp) <| hb' hKK').trans <| csInf_le'
    ⟨α • f, fun x ↦ (inv_le_iff_one_le_mul₀' (zero_lt_one.trans hα)).mp, by simp⟩
```

```suggestion
  apply le_trans _ hg.2.le
```

```suggestion
lemma exist_add_eq {f₁ f₂ : C_c(α, ℝ≥0)} (h : f₁.1 ≤ f₂.1) : ∃ (g : C_c(α, ℝ≥0)), f₁ + g = f₂ := by
```

Here is a golf
```suggestion
  refine ⟨⟨f₂.1 - f₁.1, ?_⟩, ?_⟩
  · apply (f₁.hasCompactSupport'.union f₂.hasCompactSupport').of_isClosed_subset isClosed_closure
    rw [tsupport, tsupport, ← closure_union]
    apply closure_mono
    intro x hx
    contrapose! hx
    simp only [ContinuousMap.toFun_eq_coe, coe_toContinuousMap, Set.mem_union, Function.mem_support,
      ne_eq, not_or, Decidable.not_not, ContinuousMap.coe_sub, Pi.sub_apply] at hx ⊢
    simp [hx.1, hx.2]
  · ext x
    simpa [← NNReal.coe_add] using add_tsub_cancel_of_le (h x)
```

```suggestion
  PartialOrder.lift (fun f => \u=f) (fun f g _ => by aesop)
```
Also consider making this a new PR, for discoverability
I opened #21206. sorry, I don't understand this suggested commit (it fails).
Sorry, I was on my phone so couldn't input the unicode. You are supposed to type `\u=f`
I see. As this part has been split #21206 and you made changes there, I wait for it to be merged.

pullRequest.title: feat(MeasureTheory/Integral/RieszMarkovKakutani) prove that the Riesz content is regular and define the Riesz measure
